Web UI: https://192.168.2.63

Accessibility over the Pitt Network

Currently the services are only accessible over the Local network. Accessibility over Pitt network soon.

docs.title: Welcome to Dutt lab Infra Documentation

docs.title: Open Project
docs.text: Duttlab uses open project as its project management tool. Open project is an open source software which is well suited for small to mid level teams across industries to create and manage projects.

docs.title: Installing TrueNAS scale
docs.text: Fundamental freedom of TrueNAS is its ability to run on any x86 computer.

docs.title: Installation Steps
docs.text:
1. Download the ISO file and flash it onto a bootable USB (typically pendrive)
    1. use softwares like RUFUS or Balena Etcher
    2. Download the ISO file from TrueNAS downloads
  2. Connect the bootable USB to the machine allocated for NAS
  3. Reboot
  4. Upon Restart
    1. The USB image should automatically be detected
    2. if not
      1. Go to boot menu by repeatedly pressing F12 right after system reboot
      2. change the boot priority to USB
      3. save and restart
      4. If the issue persists, disable secure boot and try again (google search for more info)
  5. TrueNAS installer pops up
    1. Set a drive to install TrueNAS OS(typically a SSD)

      Note that the Drive used to install TrueNAS is not the same used for the storage and not available for TrueNAS pool

    2. Set password for the admin user in the web authentication popup
      1. Suggested to use Duttlab's general password rules
  6. If the process went smooth, we should get an IP address where we can access the TrueNAS UI
    1. Make sure the machine is connected to the Internet. Can be a local network

for more details follow : Youtube tutorial

docs.title: Mount NAS
docs.text:
WindowsLinuxMacOS
  1. Open File Explorer 2. type "//NAS-IP" in the file explorer bar 3. provide the user name and password
    1. If you dont have username and password, contact Dr. Gurudev Dutt
  1. download the nasmounter.sh script file
    1. Present under the scripts folder in the git repository.
    2. If you don't have access to git repository, contact administrator to provide one
  2. Open terminal and navigate to the downloaded script file 
        chmod +x nasmounter.sh
    ./nasmounter.sh
  3. Provide the details it asks in the terminal like NAS-IP, localaddress, username, password etc.

soon
